title: Death of a Salesman director Marianne Elliott: ‘We don’t need more white male bullies’
text:
Death of a Salesman director Marianne Elliott on why it’s time theatre sharpened up its act. By Dominic Cavendish

When Arthur Miller’s daughter Rebecca approached Marianne Elliott asking if she’d like to stage Death of a Salesman with a black actor in the lead role, Elliott’s first thought was, effectively: “Who, me?”

“I was brought up in an environment where those sorts of shows were given to top cheese directors,” she tells me. Surely Elliott – the 52-year-old director whose game-changing, award-winning productions of War Horse, The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time and a gender-flipped Company have helped revolutionise British theatre this century – can consider herself in...
